snippet: Personnel changes are inevitable for the defending Super Bowl champions, but Coach Tom Coughlin said he wants his staff back.
abstract: New York Giants, defending Super Bowl champions who have now missed the playoffs for a second time in three seasons, face inevitable personnel changes; general manager Jerry Reese says that an evaluation process has only just begun, and coach Tom Coughlin says he wants his entire coaching staff to remain, but with nearly two dozen restricted and unrestricted free agents on the roster, there will certainly be tweaks.
lead_paragraph: Personnel changes are inevitable for the defending Super Bowl champions, but Coach Tom Coughlin said he wants his staff back.

headline.seo: Giants Insist They’re Better Than Finish
headline.main: While Carrying a Cloak of Optimism, the Giants Are Trying on Remorse
headline.print_headline: While Carrying a Cloak Of Optimism, the Giants Are Trying On Remorse
